content.text: Quality Assurance (QA) refers to the systematic processes used to monitor, evaluate, and enhance the effectiveness of educational provision. In the context of Eduversal Partner Schools, quality assurance encompasses evaluation, monitoring, improvement, and accountability.

items: Evaluation: Evidence-based assessment of teaching, learning, curriculum, assessment, and operational effectiveness.
Monitoring: Ongoing tracking of key performance indicators, student outcomes, and program implementation.
Improvement: Action-oriented responses to identified gaps, informed by data and stakeholder feedback.
Accountability: Transparent reporting to stakeholders regarding school performance and progress toward goals.

content.text: The Eduversal Quality Management System integrates multiple evaluation tools and platforms to provide comprehensive insights into school performance.

items: EASE: Standardized assessments measuring student achievement in Cambridge and National curriculum subjects.
EduNav Platform: Digital quality management system providing dashboards, KPI tracking, and evidence repositories.
DTP: Professional development program supporting continuous teacher growth.
Appraisal Program: Systematic evaluation of teacher and school performance against defined standards.
School Improvement Plan (SIP): Strategic planning tool linking goals to actions and monitoring progress.

content.text: The Principal oversees implementation of a comprehensive QA calendar covering all aspects of school operations.

steps.title: Term 1 (Semester 1 - August to December)
steps.desc: Includes SIP review, EASE baseline assessments, curriculum alignment checks, and mid-year assessments.

steps.title: Term 2 (Semester 2 - January to June)
steps.desc: Includes goal-setting, Cambridge examinations, accreditation evidence review, and annual self-evaluation report.

items: Internal audits structured around five key domains aligned with CIS/WASC standards.
Evidence collection through document review, observations, interviews, and data analysis.

subsections.title: Lesson Study and Professional Learning Communities (PLCs)

content.text: Lesson study is a collaborative professional development approach where teachers jointly plan, observe, analyze, and refine lessons to improve teaching effectiveness.

steps.title: Collaborative Planning
steps.desc: Identify learning goals and develop lesson plans.

steps.title: Research Lesson
steps.desc: One teacher teaches while others observe.

steps.title: Post-Lesson Discussion
steps.desc: Reflect on the lesson and analyze student learning outcomes.

steps.title: Revision and Re-Teaching
steps.desc: Revise lesson based on insights and re-teach if necessary.

steps.title: Reflection and Dissemination
steps.desc: Prepare summary of learning and share insights.

content.text: PLCs are collaborative teams of educators focused on continuous improvement of teaching and student learning through inquiry and data analysis.
Moderation ensures that assessment judgments are fair, accurate, and consistent across classes and teachers.

items: Pre-Assessment Moderation: Collaborative development of common assessment tasks.
During-Assessment Moderation: Blind double-marking and ongoing checks.
Post-Assessment Moderation: Review marked work and analyze grade distributions.

content.text: Benchmarking involves monitoring cohort progress and analyzing trends in key subject areas.

items: Internal Benchmarking: Longitudinal tracking and cross-class comparisons.
External Benchmarking: Cambridge assessments and EASE results.

content.text: The SSER is a comprehensive document that evaluates school performance against CIS/WASC standards and SIP goals.

steps.title: August-September
steps.desc: Leadership team reviews SSER template and departments conduct self-evaluations.

steps.title: October-November
steps.desc: Draft sections compiled and stakeholder consultations conducted.

steps.title: December
steps.desc: Final SSER drafted and presented to Board for review.

subsections.title: External Quality Assurance: Eduversal School Appraisal

content.text: The Eduversal School Appraisal is a comprehensive external review conducted annually to evaluate overall institutional performance.

items: Pre-Appraisal Preparation: Evidence submission and logistics coordination.
During the Appraisal Visit: Subject teacher appraisals and school meetings.
Post-Appraisal Follow-Up: Written report detailing findings and action planning.

content.text: Eduversal Partner Schools use the PDSA cycle as a framework for continuous improvement.

steps.title: Plan
steps.desc: Identify a problem and develop a hypothesis.

steps.title: Do
steps.desc: Implement the pilot and collect data.

steps.title: Act
steps.desc: Decide on next steps based on findings.

subsections.title: Roles and Responsibilities in Quality Assurance

content.text: The Principal holds ultimate accountability for quality assurance and continuous improvement.

items: Principal: Champion a culture of continuous improvement and oversee QA calendar.
Vice Principal: Coordinate logistics of audits and support Principal in data analysis.
Subject Leaders: Facilitate departmental moderation and ensure curriculum alignment.
Teachers: Engage in self-reflection and participate in QA processes.
Board of Trustees: Review annual SSER and monitor compliance with standards.

subsections.title: Quality Assurance in Specific Operational Areas

content.text: Quality assurance processes are applied across various operational areas including teaching, curriculum, assessment, safeguarding, and financial management.

items: Teaching Quality Assurance: Observation cycles and support for struggling teachers.
Curriculum Quality Assurance: Alignment checks and curriculum review cycles.
Assessment Quality Assurance: Design quality checks and post-assessment reviews.
Safeguarding Quality Assurance: Annual audits and staff training compliance.
Operational and Financial Quality Assurance: Budget monitoring and compliance audits.

content.text: Quality assurance findings are reported to various stakeholders including the Board, leadership team, and teachers.

items: Internal Reporting: Quarterly Board meetings and weekly leadership updates.
External Reporting: Quarterly reports to Eduversal management and annual reports to the Ministry of Education.

subsections.title: Building a Culture of Continuous Improvement

content.text: Leadership practices that foster improvement include modeling reflective practice and celebrating learning.

items: Professional Development: Needs-based and embedded in daily practice.
Student Voice: Engaging students in feedback and improvement initiatives.

content.text: Quality assurance processes are designed to generate evidence for accreditation.

items: Alignment with CIS/WASC Standards: Evidence collection and self-study preparation.
Accreditation Visit Preparation: Organizing evidence and stakeholder preparation.

content.text: Quality assurance processes align with various standards including CIS, WASC, and Indonesian regulatory compliance.

items: CIS/WASC Alignment: Curriculum review and evaluation.
Cambridge International Alignment: Regular review of center practices.
Indonesian Regulatory Compliance: Monitoring of curriculum content and teaching processes.

content.text: Key evidence should be systematically collected and organized for internal review, external appraisal, and accreditation processes.

items: Strategic Planning and Monitoring: Current strategic plan, annual SIP, and KPI targets.
Quality Assurance Processes: Annual QA calendar and internal audit reports.
Teaching Quality: Observation schedules and lesson study documentation.
Curriculum and Assessment: Curriculum maps and assessment calendars.
Student Learning Data: EASE reports and cohort progress tracking.

content.text: Templates and tools are provided to support the implementation of quality assurance processes.

items: Internal Audit Protocol Template: For planning and documenting audits.
Data Conversation Protocol: For structured discussions on data analysis.
PDSA Cycle Documentation Template: For tracking improvement initiatives.

content.text: Quality assurance and internal review are means to improve student learning, development, and wellbeing. An effective QA system is comprehensive, systematic, evidence-based, collaborative, action-oriented, and sustainable.
